alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 6:43PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southern Bonner, northwestern Shoshone and northeastern Kootenai Counties through 615 PM PST... At 539 PM PST, trained weather spotters reported gusty winds and low visibility along with quick burst of snow accumulation in a short period of time within a band of snow, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, low visibility, blowing snow. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Low visibility in intense snow showers could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs or branches and blow around unsecured objects. Roads could become very slick due to snow accumulating and re-freezing. Locations impacted include... Sandpoint, Ponderay, Kootenai, Dover, Clark Fork, East Hope, Hope, Cabinet, Cocolalla, Careywood, Granite, Bayview and Magee Ranger Station. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 454 and 475. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 12 and 17, and between mile markers 25 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
